Word for the day:

il sostituto / người thế chổ
surrogate - a substitute

Ex. He could not attend the meeting, so he sent his surrogate.

Word of the day:

intrepido / gan dạ
intrepid - fearless; adventurous

Ex. To be an astronaut, you must be an intrepid person.

Word for the day:

in rapido aumento / tăng giá
soar - increase rapidly

Ex. The cost of living continued to soar.

Idiom of the day:

goloso di dolci
sweet tooth - a liking for sweet food

Ex. John eats candy all the time. He must have a sweet tooth.

Word for the day:

debole /dòn
frail-very weak

Ex.In his old age his health became increasingly frail.

Word for the day:

il rifugio / chổ trốn tránh
sanctuary -a place of refuge or safety

Ex. People sought a sanctuary in times of trouble.

Word for the day:

costringere / bắt buộc
compel - to force someone to do something

Ex. We took steps to compel their cooperation.

Word for the day:

terribile / ghê gớm
fearsome - very frightening

Ex. Tiger is a fearsome beast.

Word for the day:

persuadere /llàm cho tin
persuade -cause someone to believe something
Ex.It was hard to persuade him to cancel the trip.

Word for the day:

acconsentire / bằng lòng
assent - express approval or agreement

Ex. The President assented to the agreement.

Word for the day:

caotico / lộn xộn
chaotic - in a state of complete confusion

Ex. We do live in a seemingly chaotic world.

Word for the day:

trattenere / chế ngự
restrain - to prevent from doing something

Ex. He tried to restrain the dog from attacking him.

Word for the day:

insolito / bất thường
unusual - not common

Ex. She has an unusual name.

Word for the day:

consolare / khuyên giải
console - to comfort someone at a time of grief

Ex. Nothing could console her after his death.

Word for the day:

la disputa / bàn cải
dispute - a disagreement or argument

Ex. Never let a little dispute injure a great relationship.

Word for the day:

forgiare / rèn luyện
forge - to copy or imitate

Ex. Someone had tried to forge her signature on a check.

Word for the day:
incentivo
incentive -a thing that motivates someone to do something
Ex.The company gives incentives for the best employee.

Word for the day:

debellare / tiêu diệt
eradicate - to remove completely

Ex. His ambition is to eradicate poverty in his community.

Word for the day:

obsoleto / lỗi thời
outdated - very old

Ex. They fail their distributors by using outdated marketing techniques.

Word for the day:

insulto / điều làm nhục
insult - lack of respect

Ex. The crowd yelled insults at the players of the losing team.

Word for the day:

informarsi / hỏi thăm
inquire - ask for information

Ex. Someone phoned today to inquire about our car for sale.

arretrato
backlog - work accumulated

Word for the day:

pericolo
peril - danger

Word for the day:

febbrile
hectic - very busy and filled with activity

Ex. She maintains a hectic schedule as a journalist and mother.

Word for the day:

tentare
attempt - to try to do (something)

Ex.  I will attempt to talk to him on Monday.

Word for the day:

brama
craving - a very strong desire for something

Ex. The pregnant woman with a craving for pickles.

Word for the day:

intatto
intact - not damaged

Ex. The old castle was still intact after over 1000 years.

Word for the day:

rifiutare

Ex. She refuse to answer the question.

Word for the day:

rivelare
reveal - make something known

Ex. The study revealed the toxic effects of the pollutant.

Word for the day:

imporre
impose - force to be accepted

richiamare

deviare

aloof - not friendly

Word for the day:

duraturo
enduring - long-lasting

Ex. His song remains one of his enduring legacies.

Word for the day:

vulnerabile
vulnerable – sensitive, susceptible to hurt 

Ex. She felt very vulnerable after her divorce.

Word for the day:

infruttuoso
fruitless - unsuccessful

Ex.They made a fruitless attempt to find a solution.

Word for the day:

fraudolento
fraudulent - illegal, dishonest

Ex. She was arrested for attempting to use a fraudulent credit card.

Word for the day:

estatico
rapturous - showing great pleasure

Ex. The band was greeted with rapturous applause.

Word for the day:

scrutinio
scrutiny - careful examination

Ex. Laptops and mobiles will come under greater scrutiny.

enorme

Ex.He made a tremendous effort and lifted the heavy weight.

Parola del giorno : (Word for the day)

disputa/ discussione
dispute - argue about something.

Ex. I disputed the charge on the bill.

ricambiare
reciprocate - respond in same way

Ex. Her kindness was not reciprocated.

convincere
convince - make someone agree or believe to something
Ex. He convinced him to learn English.

Utile inglese espressione:

tenere a mente
keep in mind = remember or consider

Ex. You must keep in mind that English is important.

Parola del giorno : (Word for the day)

timido
diffident - lack of self-confidence 

Ex. She was diffident about stating her opinion.

Parola del giorno : (Word for the day)

concedere
grant - allow to have ; give

Ex.  The genie granted him a wish.

Word for the day:

ambiguous - unclear or inexact

Ex: Ambiguous communication won't relay the correct news.

Useful English Expression:

"Hang out" - to spend time with 

Ex. Would you like to hang out with me this afternoon?

Useful English Expression:

"take it easy" - relax

Ex: I'm going to stay home on Saturday and take it easy.

Word for the day:

"spot" means "see" 

Ex. He spotted the woman slowly walking into the sea.

English Expression:
"easy as pie" means very easy / very simple
Sample Sentence:The job was easy as pie, and we finished up an hour early.

Useful English Expression:
Feel blue = Be depressed or to feel sad

"Whenever I feel blue, I like to listen to music."

commemorate=to remember something officially and with respect
Ex.
She has been criticised for not doing enough to commemorate the centenary.

robust = strong and unlikely to fail
Ex.
France's robust military response to threats in Mali and the Central African Republic.

of sound mind = rational, mentally healthy
Ex.
Your spouse might not think you're of sound mind right now, but that's beside the point!

stranded = stuck; unable to leave somewhere
Ex.
The petrol tanker became stranded off the island of San Cristobal on Friday.

abruptly = suddenly
Ex.
Users told them that the service ended abruptly over a year ago.

a necessary evil = something you don't like or enjoy but have to accept
Ex.
For many people commuting is a necessary evil. #learnenglish

outrage = anger and shock
Ex.
The latest in a series of violent deaths at the college has outraged public opinion.

cool down = slow down the increase in
Ex.
The government's efforts to cool down property prices have not worked.

overlooked = did not notice
Ex.
He overlooked love and friendship in favor of materialistic things. #LearnEnglish

trustworthy = reliable and honest
Ex.
I have a trustworthy best friend.

at play = involved, having an effect
Ex.
Research suggests there are more complex factors at play behind most conflicts.

vanish = disappear
Ex.
Upper Tanana is spoken by fewer than 25 people in Alaska and may soon vanish.

coffers=the money that an organisation has in its bank accounts
bolstering=supporting
Ex.
The country's coffers urgently need bolstering.

adrift = (of a boat) moving across the water but not controlled by anyone
Ex.
 Jose was adrift at sea for 16 months.

play it by ear = dealing with a situation as it develops

hit the hay = sleep
ex). It's already 1AM, it's time for me to hit the hay.

Today's Phrase: 
I'm feeling down in the dumps. = I'm depressed
ex) I've been feeling down in the dumps since my dog died.
